intro: Conospermum brownii, commonly known as the pink conospermum, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its distinctive pink or red flowers that bloom in spring and summer. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slight pubescence. Conospermum brownii is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is well adapted to the dry climates of its native range.
